book.title: GT version Replication Client: User's Guide

abstract.title: Introduction
abstract.para: The user guide describes the key usage scenarios of the Replication Client and it describes its command line interface.

chapter.title: Replicating data with the Replication Client
chapter.para: This section describes a few key usage scenarios and provides examples of using the Replication Client command-line tools. The command-line client may be found at $GLOBUS_LOCATION/bin/globus-replication-client. For a complete list of options use the help option.
The client supports common data operations, such as put, get, copy, delete, and also register and replicate. The following examples assume that:

listitem.simpara: an RLS is running on the local host using the default port (39281);
the local RLS catalg is updating the local RLS index service (OPTIONAL); and
a GridFTP Server is running on the local host using port 9001.

section.title: Put
section.para: The put command takes a source file, either a local file (e.g., file://...) or a remote file (e.g., gsiftp://...), transfers it to a destination location, and registers it with a designated logical name.
section.screen: % echo "FOO WAS HERE!" > foo.orig % $GLOBUS_LOCATION/bin/globus-replication-client -r rls://localhost put \ ./foo.orig foo gsiftp://hostname:9001/tmp/foo.put
